name: angular-directive
comment:
Directives for angular.dart, a web framework for Dart. A directive attaches a specified behavior to a DOM element.

This library is included as part of angular.dart. It provides all of the core Directives available in Angular. You can extend Angular by writing your own directives and providing them as part of a custom library.

Directives consist of a class specifying the behavior, and a directive annotation (such as a angular-core-annotation_src.Decorator or a angular-core-annotation_src.Component) that describes when the behavior should be applied.

For example:

<span ng-show="ctrl.isVisible">this text is conditionally visible</span>

class.name: NgModelMaxLengthValidator
class.preview: Validates the model to see if the length of its contents are less than or equal to the maximum length set in place by the HTML maxlength or ng-maxlength attributes present on the input element.

class.name: NgModelMinLengthValidator
class.preview: Validates the model to see if the length of its contents are greater than or equal to the minimum length set in place by the HTML minlength or ng-minlength attributes present on the input element.

class.name: NgModelPatternValidator
class.preview: Validates the model to see if its contents match the given pattern present on either the HTML pattern or ng-pattern attributes present on the input element.

class.name: NgModelMinNumberValidator
class.preview: Validates the model to see if the numeric value is greater than or equal to the min value.

class.name: NgModelMaxNumberValidator
class.preview: Validates the model to see if the numeric value than or equal to the max value.

class.name: NgModelNumberValidator
class.preview: Validates the model to see if its contents match a valid number.

class.name: NgModelEmailValidator
class.preview: Validates the model to see if its contents match a valid email pattern.

class.name: NgModelUrlValidator
class.preview: Validates the model to see if its contents match a valid URL pattern.

class.name: NgModelRequiredValidator
class.preview: Validates the model depending if required or ng-required is present on the element.

class.name: NgValidator
class.preview: NgValidator is the class interface for performing validations for an NgModel instance.

class.name: NgForm
class.preview: The form directive listens on submission requests and, depending, on if an action is set, the form will automatically either allow or prevent the default browser submission from occurring.

class.name: OptionValue
class.preview: Since the value attribute of the OPTION can only be a string, Angular provides ng-value which allows binding to any expression.

class.name: InputSelect
class.preview: HTML SELECT element with angular data-binding if used with angular-directive.NgModel.

class.name: NgNonBindable
class.preview: Causes the compiler to ignore all Angular directives and markup on descendant nodes of the matching element. Note, however, that other directives and markup on the element are still processed and that only descending the DOM for compilation is prevented.

class.name: NgSwitch
class.preview: The ngSwitch directive is used to conditionally swap DOM structure on your template based on a scope expression. Elements within ngSwitch but without ngSwitchWhen or ngSwitchDefault directives will be preserved at the location as specified in the template.

class.name: NgStyle
class.preview: The ngStyle directive allows you to set CSS style on an HTML element conditionally.

class.name: NgAttribute
class.preview: In SVG some attributes have a specific syntax. Placing {{interpolation}} in those attributes will break the attribute syntax, and browser will clear the attribute.

class.name: NgSource
class.preview: In browser some attributes have network side-effect. If the attribute has {{interpolation}} in it it may cause browser to fetch bogus URLs.

class.name: NgBooleanAttribute
class.preview: Allows adding and removing the boolean attributes from the element.

class.name: NgShow
class.preview: The ngShow directive shows or hides the given HTML element based on the expression provided to the ngHide attribute. The element is shown or hidden by changing the removing or adding the ng-hide CSS class onto the element.

class.name: NgHide
class.preview: The ngHide directive shows or hides the given HTML element based on the expression provided to the ngHide attribute. The element is shown or hidden by changing the removing or adding the ng-hide CSS class onto the element.

class.name: NgTemplate
class.preview: The angular-directive.NgTemplate allows one to preload an Angular template into the angular-core-dom_internal.TemplateCache. It works on <template> and <script> elements that have type="text/ng-template. For such elements, The entire contents of the elements are loaded into the angular-core-dom_internal.TemplateCache under the URL specified by the id attribute.

class.name: NgRepeat
class.preview: The ngRepeat directive instantiates a template once per item from a collection. Each template instance gets its own scope, where the given loop variable is set to the current collection item, and $index is set to the item index or key.

class.name: NgPluralize
class.preview:
Overview

ngPluralize is a directive that displays messages according to locale rules.

class.name: ContentEditable
class.preview: Usage (span could be replaced with any element which supports text content, such as p):

class.preview: Usage:

class.preview: Usage:

class.preview: Usage:

class.name: InputDateLike
class.preview: Background: Standards and Browsers

class.name: NgBindTypeForDateLike
class.preview: This directive affects which IDL attribute will be used to read the value of date/time related input directives. Recognized values for this directive are:

class.preview: Usage:

class.name: InputTextLike

class.name: InputCheckbox

class.name: NgModel
class.preview: Ng-model directive is responsible for reading/writing to the model. The directive itself is headless. (It does not know how to render or what events to listen for.) It is meant to be used with other directives which provide the rendering and listening capabilities. The directive itself knows how to convert the view-value into model-value and vice versa by allowing others to register converters (To be implemented). It also knows how to (in)validate the model and the form in which it is declared (to be implemented)

class.name: NgModelConverter
class.preview: NgModelConverter is the class interface for performing transformations on the viewValue and modelValue properties on a model. A new converter can be created by implementing the NgModelConverter class and then attaching to a model via the provided setter.

class.name: NgControl
class.preview: The NgControl class is a super-class for handling info and error states between inner controls and models. NgControl will automatically apply the associated CSS classes for the error and info states that are applied as well as status flags. NgControl is used with the form and fieldset as well as all other directives that are used for user input with NgModel.

class.name: NgInclude
class.preview: Fetches, compiles and includes an external Angular template/HTML.

class.name: NgUnless
class.preview: The ng-unless directive complements the ng-if (provided by angular-directive.NgIf) directive.

class.name: NgIf
class.preview: The ng-if directive compliments the ng-unless (provided by angular-directive.NgUnless) directive.

class.name: NgCloak
class.preview: The ngCloak directive is used to prevent the Angular html template from being briefly displayed by the browser in its raw (uncompiled) form while your application is loading. Use this directive to avoid the undesirable flicker effect caused by the html template display.

class.name: NgEvent
class.preview: Allows you to specify custom behavior for DOM UI events such as mouse, keyboard and touch events.

class.name: NgClassEven
class.preview: The ngClassOdd and ngClassEven directives work exactly as {@link ng.directive:ngClass ngClass}, except it works in conjunction with ngRepeat and takes affect only on odd (even) rows.

class.name: NgClassOdd
class.preview: The ngClassOdd and ngClassEven directives work exactly as {@link ng.directive:ngClass ngClass}, except it works in conjunction with ngRepeat and takes affect only on odd (even) rows.

class.name: NgClass
class.preview: The ngClass directive allows you to dynamically style an HTML element, by binding to an expression that represents the classes to be bound.

class.name: NgBindTemplate
class.preview: The angular-directive.NgBindTemplate specifies that the element text content should be replaced with the interpolation of the template in the ngBindTemplate attribute. Unlike ngBind, the ngBindTemplate can contain multiple {{ }} expressions.

class.name: NgBindHtml
class.preview: Creates a binding that will innerHTML the result of evaluating the expression bound to ng-bind-html into the current element in a secure way. This expression must evaluate to a string. The innerHTML-ed content will be sanitized using a default NodeValidator constructed as new dom.NodeValidatorBuilder.common(). In a future version, when Strict Contextual Escaping support has been added to Angular.dart, this directive will allow one to bypass the sanitization and innerHTML arbitrary trusted HTML.

class.name: NgBind
class.preview: The ngBind attribute tells Angular to replace the text content of the specified HTML element with the value of a given expression, and to update the text content when the value of that expression changes.

class.name: AHref
class.preview: @ngdoc directive @name ng.directive:a @restrict E
